title: Fluids - Buoyant force on a prism

content.description: A solid prism in the shape of a right triangle as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, can be placed in any of the three orientations shown in Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. The prism is placed in a large tank containing a liquid and the prism sinks to the bottom of the tank. <math alttext="F sub X" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math> is the magnitude of the buoyant force exerted on the prism by the liquid in the tank when the prism is in Orientation <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math>. <math alttext="F sub Y" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></math> and <math alttext="F sub Z" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></math> are the buoyant forces for orientations <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math> and <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Z</mtext></math>.
content.question: Which of the following correctly ranks the magnitude of the three buoyant forces?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub Y is less than F sub X, which is less than F sub Z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="F sub Z is less than F sub X, which is less than F sub Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, F sub Y equals F sub X, close parenthesis, is less than F sub Z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo><</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="F sub Y equals F sub X, which equals F sub Z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="F sub Y equals F sub X, which equals F sub Z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
